alert.note: Alert for Camden; Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Camden and northwestern Burlington Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cherry Hill Mall, or near Camden, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Camden, Cherry Hill, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Mount Holly, Riverside, Palmyra, Bordentown, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Ramblewood, Barclay-Kingston, Cherry Hill Mall, Golden Triangle, Marlton, Jacksonville and Erlton-Ellisburg. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 7A. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 29 and 30, and between mile markers 33 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
